data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word وَاللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word عَلِيمٌ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
The word مِنْهُ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to be ample, take in, comprehend, embrace.
data.sentence: The word وَاسِعٌ comes from the root و س ع and is associated with the meanings: to be ample, take in, comprehend, embrace.

data.meanings: to promise, give one's word, threaten, promise good, threaten (depending on context).. . Wa'ada act (pr.f 3rd. p. m. sing.): He promised.. Wa'adta (prf. 2nd. p. m. sing.): Thou promised.. Wa'adtu (prf. 1st. p. m. sing.): I promised.. Wa'aduu (prf. 3rd. p. plu.): They promised.. Wa'adna  (prf. 1st. p. m.): We promise.. Ya'idu (imp. 3rd. p. m. sing.): He promises, threatens.. 'Id (prt. m. sing.): promise.. Wu'ida (pp. 3rd. p. sing.): Has been promised.. Yuu'aduuna (pip. 3rd. p. plu.): They were threatened.. Tu'aduuna  (pip. 2nd. p. plu.) You are promised, are threatened.. Mau'uud (pic. pact. n. sing.): Promised.. Tuu'aduuna  (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. II.): (Punishment which) you are promised.. Waa'adna (imp. 1st. p. plu. III.): We made an appointment, a promise.. Tawaa'dtum (prf. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have mutually appointed.. Laa Tawaa'duu  (prt. neg. m.plu.): Do not appoint mutually; Make no agreement or promises.. Wa'iid (act. 2nd. pic. m. sing.): Threatening; Threat; Warning.. Mau'idan (n. place): Time; Place or time of the fulfilment of a prediction; Promise or warning; Appointment for meeting a promise.. Mii'aad  (for Miu'aad; n. place): Time; Time or place of the promise.
data.sentence: The word يَعِدُكُمُ comes from the root و ع د and is associated with the meanings: to promise, give one's word, threaten, promise good, threaten (depending on context).. . II.): (Punishment which) you are promised.. Waa'adna (imp. 1st. p. plu. III.): We made an appointment, a promise.. Tawaa'dtum (prf. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have mutually appointed.. Laa Tawaa'duu  (prt. neg. m.plu.): Do not appoint mutually; Make no agreement or promises.. Wa'iid (act. 2nd. pic. m. sing.): Threatening; Threat; Warning.. data.meanings: to be poor/destitute/needy, in want of, poverty. faqira / faqara - to overwhelm with back breaking calamity, feel a pain in the vertebrae.
data.sentence: The word الْفَقْرَ comes from the root ف ق ر and is associated with the meanings: to be poor/destitute/needy, in want of, poverty. faqira / faqara - to overwhelm with back breaking calamity, feel a pain in the vertebrae.

data.meanings: command/order/enjoin, authority/power/dominion, counselled/advised/consulted, hold/appoint command, preside as a commander/governor/prince/king, experienced, become many/abundant.
data.sentence: The word وَيَأْمُرُكُمْ comes from the root ا م ر and is associated with the meanings: command/order/enjoin, authority/power/dominion, counselled/advised/consulted, hold/appoint command, preside as a commander/governor/prince/king, experienced, become many/abundant.

data.meanings: became excessive/immoderate/enormous/exorbitant/overmuch/beyond measure, foul/bad/evil/unseemly/indecency/abominable, lewd/gross/obscene, committing excess which is forbidden, transgress the bounds/limits, avaricious, adultery/fornication.
data.sentence: The word بِالْفَحْشَاءِ comes from the root ف ح ش and is associated with the meanings: became excessive/immoderate/enormous/exorbitant/overmuch/beyond measure, foul/bad/evil/unseemly/indecency/abominable, lewd/gross/obscene, committing excess which is forbidden, transgress the bounds/limits, avaricious, adultery/fornication.
